page.title: 13A PUBLIC HOUSE IN BLACKBURN
page.content: The landlord of the Rock Inn, Tockholes, Blackburn, has been living in this former farmhouse for seven years since moving from the industrialised area of Bury. The pub belongs to Thwaites Brewery, meaning the landlord must buy all beers and spirits from them. Mixer drinks and cigarettes can be bought elsewhere as a result of a recent EEC ruling. The pub's opening times are 11a.m. to 3p.m. and 5.30p.m. to 11p.m. Meals, such as pies and chips, are served every day except Monday. This new idea has boosted the number of people coming into the pub. Most of the regulars are over 20 years of age, the majority travel to the pub by car but others walk. Fewer customers frequent the pub in winter because snow blocks the approach road.
